Mountain_View.Shockley Semiconductor Laboratory:
Shockley Semiconductor Laboratory was a pioneering semiconductor developer founded by renowned inventor William Shockley as a division of Beckman Instruments, Inc., in 1956. It was the first high technology company in what came to be known as Silicon Valley to work on silicon-based semiconductor devices.
In 1957, the division's eight leading scientists resigned and became the core of what became Fairchild Semiconductor.
